body_html:
It makes sense for tf.decode_csv to be slower than tf.parse_example, since tf.train.Examples are designed to be decoded fast while CSVs are not. When training, I would recommend first converting your data into tf.train.Examples.

If you find that TensorFlow decodes CSVs significantly slower than some other CSV decoder implementation, then reopen this issue.
body_text:
It makes sense for tf.decode_csv to be slower than tf.parse_example, since tf.train.Examples are designed to be decoded fast while CSVs are not. When training, I would recommend first converting your data into tf.train.Examples.
If you find that TensorFlow decodes CSVs significantly slower than some other CSV decoder implementation, then reopen this issue.
body:
It makes sense for `tf.decode_csv` to be slower than `tf.parse_example`, since `tf.train.Example`s are designed to be decoded fast while CSVs are not. When training, I would recommend first converting your data into `tf.train.Example`s.

If you find that TensorFlow decodes CSVs significantly slower than some other CSV decoder implementation, then reopen this issue.
